result.execSummary:
The defendant Abraham A Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court granted defendant credit for 53 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes:
ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES WAIVED DUE TO LOW INCOME.
- Restitution is set at zero.

- Referred to the mental health unit of probation.
- Take all prescribed medications.

timeConds.notes: At The Day Reporting Center for programming on electronic monitoring if accepted. If not accepted at DRC NO CONDITION TIME.

supervisions.notes: - Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12/05/2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; straight time, with credit for 129 days time served. The Court does NOT note an objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abraham A Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Abraham A Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Abraham A Harris in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; straight time, with credit for 129 days time served. The Court does NOT note an objection to electronic monitoring. 

- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12/05/2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Filed;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Sentencing hearing on revocation. Defense counsel requests more time. Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing hearing on revocation in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for October 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
(x )   SENTENCE AFTER REVOCATION

Defendant Abraham A Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Abraham A Harris in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 53 days  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEAR with the following conditions:
referred to the mental health unit of probation
*take all prescribed medications
*restitution set at zero
*condition time in the amount of six months at the Day Reporting Center for programming on electronic monitoring if accepted. If not accept at DRC NO CONDITION TIME. 
*ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES WAIVED DUE TO LOW INCOME 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Abraham A Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Abraham A Harris in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State is challenging the finding of competency by Forensics.  Competency hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Dr. Robert Rawski.  Exhibits 1 & 2, received and filed.  Arguments heard.  Court placed findings on the record.  Court finds the defendant competent to proceed.  Exhibit List, filed.

Defendant Abraham A Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Abraham A Harris in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of doctor's report. No corrections or additions.  The doctor's report finds the defendant competent. State is contesting the findings. Court ordered case set for competency hearing. Bail the same.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Doctor's report received.   Case is adjourned to Br. 47 for doctor's report. .  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informs the court that they believe the defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be re- examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.    Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return in Branch 47. Defendant currently detained in children's detention center. Both parties requested Dr. Rawski to reevaluate the defendant.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn is granted by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant being held in Children's court detention center.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Court set bail in the amount of $1000.00 personal recognizance bond, which is to  REVERT TO CASH if the Children's court hold is released.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.

Defendant Abraham A Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Abraham A Harris in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(4)(a), Wisconsin Statutes, all parties have a  copy of the doctor's report . No corrections or additions.  All parties stipulate to the findings in the Doctor's report indicating the Defendant is Competent to proceed. Court reinstates the proceedings.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Abraham A Harris not in court, in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Wait had no appointment papers by the PD's office and requested another date.   Case is adjourned to Br. 47 for return on doctor's report..  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Abraham A Harris in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Abraham A Harris in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed based on pending juvenile case.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
